definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
individual/this/that/size/classifier for people or objects in general
stupid great hulk of a man

sentences.english: The big dragoon was as helpless as a baby.
sentences.chinese: 這龍騎兵大個兒象嬰兒似的毫無辦法。

sentences.english: Battle, in order to save a little girl, big heroic sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 戰鬥中，大個兒爲了救一個小女孩，壯烈犧牲了。

sentences.english: The big man crowded the child out of his way.
sentences.chinese: 那個大個兒將小孩擠開。

sentences.english: It's usually the big guy who's alone in the corner.
sentences.chinese: 通常是大個兒獨自在角落裏。

sentences.english: Ross: It felt like a 'big guy' moment.
Large hail was banging into cars and windows.
sentences.chinese: 大個兒的冰雹落入轎車中，落入窗戶中。

sentences.english: Mark Cuban's best player is still a tall gawky German guy.
sentences.chinese: 馬克庫班的最好的球員依然是那個遲鈍的德國大個兒。

sentences.english: How pretty, I want a big one.
sentences.chinese: 好可愛啊，我要買一個大個兒的。

sentences.english: Give me some apples . I want big ones.
sentences.chinese: 給我一些蘋果，我要大個兒的。

definition: lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
A rabbit doesn't eat the grass by its own burrow (idiom); One shouldn't do anything to harm one's neighbors.
pinyin: tu4 zi5 bu4 chi1 wo1 bian1 cao3

definition: sb who goes whichever way the wind blows/sb with no mind of their own/easily swayed person/opportunist
